N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 27.5 - Medical care and treatment

State Regulations
(a) General. Directors and staff of facilities shall provide services
for mental disability in such a manner that patients receive care and treatment
that is suited to their needs and skillfully, safely, and humanely administered
with full respect for their dignity and personal integrity. (b) Periodic physical
examinations. Directors and staff of facilities shall provide each
patient with a physical examination at not less than 12-month intervals. A
chest X-ray shall be part of the examination for adults of middle age and
older. Annual physical examinations for outpatients should be provided through
the usual medical resources in the community. (c) Emergency care. Directors and staff of facilities shall provide each
patient, directly or by formal agreement with a qualified provider, emergency
medical care for illness or injuries whenever such care is
needed. (d) Serious
illness or injury. Appropriate members of staff of facilities shall
immediately notify the legal guardian, family, or close friend of any patient
who develops a serious illness or sustains a serious injury. (e) Physician's orders. Directors and medical staff of facilities shall assure that
treatments which require a physician's order include a termination date and are
written and signed within 24 hours after they are issued. A physician should
review, rewrite, and sign new orders on the termination date of the old
orders. Notes
